pages.text:
We are the Space & Treasure Coast's #1 Vacation Rental Manager
At Happy Palm Stays, we put our owners and guests first. We offer the largest selection of premium vacation properties on the Space Coast coupled with a highly professional, market leading team. Our local team’s mission is to provide exceptional customer service from beginning to end so you have a phenomenal vacation experience. As the area's top vacation rental manager and winner of the industry's top awards, we look forward to welcoming you.
Contact Us
We are the Space & Treasure Coast's #1 Vacation Rental Manager
At Happy Palm Stays, we put our owners and guests first. We offer the largest selection of premium vacation properties on the Space Coast coupled with a highly professional, market leading team. Our local team’s mission is to provide exceptional customer service from beginning to end so you have a phenomenal vacation experience. As the area's top vacation rental manager and winner of the industry's top awards, we look forward to welcoming you.
Contact Us
Meet The Happy Palm Stays Team
Kelsy
Head of Owner Success
Hometown:
Baltimore, MD
Favorite Restaurant:
Top 3 are Rusty's at the Port, Rising Tide, and Nosh.
Favorite hidden gem:
Jetty Park, I love going there to watch the cruise ships depart! The Disney cruise ships horn plays "When you wish upon a star" as it leaves. It is magical! You can also fish right from the rocks there!
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
The Space coast itself! Our unique retro beach town charm is extremely refreshing and surprising to most out of towners!
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Waking up to watch the sunrise, getting breakfast at Southern Charm Café, watching the surfers at the Cocoa Beach Pier, lunch at Papa Vito's, afternoon fishing charter out of the port (I am determined to catch a Mahi Mahi!), and ending the day with my family and my dog either grilling at home, or at one of our amazing restaurants in town!
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
Our small family business mindset is what trickles down to our guests. At the end of the day our family wants your family to have an amazing stay! We provide you with the best accommodations on the space coast so you can enjoy your stay and explore our little slice of heaven!
Madison
Owner Success
Hometown:
Merritt Island, FL
Favorite Restaurant:
Grills Seafood
Favorite hidden gem:
The Sebastian Inlet! Spending the day at the sandbar
while boating with friends is my favorite kind of weekend!
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
Cocoa Beach
is where Kelly Slater, one of the greatest American surfers of all
time was born and raised! Look out for his statue on A1A as you head
into downtown Cocoa Beach.
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Having a sunrise coffee on the beach,
shopping at Ron Jon's Surf Shop then closing out the day in downtown
Cocoa Beach hitting all the local fav bars and restaurants.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
The team! Everyone is so close and
friendly. It's a great work environment and makes "working" that much
more enjoyable.
Savanna
Owner Success
Hometown:
Coudersport, PA
Favorite Restaurant:
Grills Seafood Deck & Tiki Bar
Favorite hidden gem:
The bioluminescence tours, they are pure magic. As you paddle through the water at night, every stroke lights up with a glowing blue-green shimmer, thanks to tiny organisms in the lagoon. It’s peaceful, surreal, and one of the most unforgettable ways to experience Florida’s natural beauty.
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
Brevard County, FL—is not just about space launches. In addition to being home to Kennedy Space Center and Cape Canaveral, it's also rich in natural beauty, with over 70 miles of coastline, the largest sea turtle nesting area in the U.S., and the biodiverse Merritt Island National Wildlife Refuge. Plus, the area has a growing arts and culture scene, charming historic downtowns like Eau Gallie and Cocoa Village, and even surfing history—Kelly Slater, an 11-time world champion surfer, hails from Cocoa Beach.
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
My perfect day in Cocoa Beach would start with breakfast at Cafe Surfinista, followed by a few relaxing hours on the beach. After soaking up the sun, I’d head to Grills for lunch or an early dinner, then wrap up the day with drinks at some of the local beach bars.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
What I love most about working for Happy Palm Stays is the energy and enthusiasm everyone brings to the team. It’s such an upbeat and supportive environment, and you can genuinely tell that people enjoy being here. Every day is a little different—which keeps things exciting—and the fast pace and constant growth make it a really fun place to be a part of.
Patrick
Business Development
Favorite Restaurant:
Long Doggers! Our daughters love the free dessert.
Favorite hidden gem:
The Brevard Zoo. There are lions, bears, a new aquarium and a splash pad for kids!
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
All of the rockets! They go off every week and we're going back to the Moon and onto Mars!
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
We are a family run company with attention to detail and our team cares about the guests and owners. Plus, we're at the beach :)
Amanda
Guest Services
Hometown:
Merritt Island, FL
Favorite Restaurant:
The Tiny Turtle
Favorite hidden gem:
The Thousand Island in Cocoa Beach.
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
It's home to the most biologically diverse estuary in North America, the Indian River Lagoon, where you can see thousands of species of plants and animals.
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
My perfect day would start with a big breakfast at Southern Charm Cafe, boating all afternoon in the lagoon and island hopping, and finish with a poolside cookout with family and friends.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
The awesome team, everybody works hard and keeps a fun environment! I also love helping people make memories in our beautiful little paradise!
Natalie
Guest Services
Hometown:
Jackson, MS
Favorite Restaurant:
One of my favorite restaurants on the Space Coast is Fishlips Waterfront Bar & Grill.
Favorite hidden gem:
Cocoa Village in Cocoa, FL, is a charming historic area. With its scenic views of the Indian River Lagoon, Cocoa Village is a great spot for shopping, dining, and enjoying the local charm.
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
The Space Coast isn’t just about rockets and space exploration—there’s so much natural beauty here too! From beautiful beaches to wildlife preserves, you can see manatees, dolphins, and all kinds of birds.
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Starting the day with a delicious breakfast at Whisk & Grind, then unwinding at the beach for the rest of the day.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
The amazing team I get to work with! Everyone is so supportive and collaborative, making it a great environment. It’s a fantastic feeling to be part of a team that truly cares about helping both our guests and each other!
Taylor
Guest Services
Hometown:
Melbourne, FL
Favorite Restaurant:
4th Street Fillin Station Gastrobar & Grill! They have delicious food and over 150 craft beers. Fun fact, this gastrobar was originally an old gas station!
Favorite hidden gem:
The Banana River Lagoon! Kayaking the lagoon is one of my favorite ways to explore the unique wildlife that inhabits Florida's Space Coast. I highly recommend booking a nighttime bioluminescence kayaking tour with Fin Expeditions! It is magical!
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
Florida's Space Coast is one of the largest nesting sites for sea turtles, representing 90% of eggs laid in the US! The three main sea turtles species that come to our beaches are the loggerhead, green and leatherback!
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Waking up early to get a chai tea latte at Juice N' Java and watching the beautiful sunrise on the beach. Then exploring nature by kayaking the Banana River Lagoon. Getting a delicious lunch and craft beer (or two!) at 4th Street Fillin Station is a must! Then exploring the unique shops in Historic Cocoa Village, followed by a seafood dinner at Florida's Fresh Grill.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
My amazing coworkers! Everyone is so friendly and we all care greatly about each other and our guests. We have a very well-rounded team that works perfectly in unison to ensure our guests have a fantastic stay in Cocoa Beach!
Zareh
Guest Services
Hometown:
Cocoa Beach, FL
Favorite Restaurant:
The Beachside Cafe - excellent breakfast and lunch spot!
Favorite hidden gem:
The beautiful intercoastal waterways of Brevard. I would recommend a kayak tour to look for dolphins, manatees, alligators, herons, and all kinds of beautiful, unique wildlife.
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
The resurgence of the Space Program. Being a child of the Space Shuttle era, it is cool to see all these new companies coming and advancing science and space exploration. If you're lucky enough to see a rocket launch on your visit it is quite the experience!
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
My wife Chloe and Scooby our dog would spend the morning on one of our beautiful dog friendly beaches. Then we would walk around downtown Cocoa Beach exploring the shops, bars, and restaurants. Finally we would have dinner at any of the amazing restaurants at Port Canaveral and watch the cruise ships sail out.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
My coworkers. From the owners of the company to our cleaning staff, everyone cares deeply about each other and our guests. Our success is derived from the passion each employee brings with them to work.
Kelly
Marketing Manager
Hometown:
Warsaw, NY
Favorite Restaurant:
I love Poke Poke in downtown Cocoa beach- their bowls are always so fresh and filling. I also really like Cafe Surfinista (especially their acai bowls). It’s the perfect sweet treat.
Favorite hidden gem:
Rockledge Gardens is my favorite hidden gem—filled with vibrant flowers, a butterfly garden, and so many beautiful paths to explore. It’s the perfect place to soak in Florida’s natural beauty, and they host fun seasonal events!
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
Backstreet Boys member Howie Dorough and his brother, John, are the owners of KOA Lounge Bar & Restaurant. The duo also developed and own The Surf, a five-story oceanfront condominium right in the heart of downtown Cocoa Beach.
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
My perfect day starts with a beautiful sunrise beach walk, followed by a refreshing iced Chai Latte from Foxtail Coffee. I’d then wander through downtown Cocoa Beach, exploring the charming local boutiques. To end the day I’d treat myself to ice cream at Surfin' Turtle during golden hour.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
The whole team is incredibly warm and welcoming, and I truly value the creative freedom I’m given. I’m encouraged to share innovative ideas and actively contribute to the company’s growth, making it an inspiring and collaborative place to work.
Steven
Operations Manager
Hometown:
Evansville, Indiana
Favorite Restaurant:
The Broken Barrel Tavern
Favorite Hidden Gem:
Intracoastal Brewing Co.
What would people be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
We have one of the oldest Native American archaeological sites in North America (roughly 7,000 years old).
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
It would be a nice early surf at the pier, followed by some beach volleyball, and then a nice lunch, with a good beer.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
It would have to be the family atmosphere. Everyone is so talented, ambitious and friendly. People genuinely enjoy working here.
John
Repair & Maintenance
Favorite Restaurant:
Rusty's at the Port and Jazzy's Mainly Lobster in downtown Cocoa Beach.
Favorite hidden gem:
The amazing fishing in and around the Thousand Island Cocoa Beach canals.
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
The resurgence of the space program led by Space X and Blue Origin. It seems like there is a launch just about every week.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
A family business that truly provides a great atmosphere for employees and guests! Hard to explain but easy to see when spending time at any of our properties!
Andrew
Partner
Favorite Restaurant:
Mangia & Bevi Pizzeria Napoletana. An excellent authentic Italian restaurant a short walk from the Pier
Favorite Hidden Gem:
Stand up Paddleboarding in the intercoastal waterways. There is always so much to see!
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Catch the sunrise from the balcony or take a quiet walk on the beach to start the day, explore Sebastian Inlet with a picnic lunch followed by ice cream with the kids on the way home and a great dinner outside.
Brianne
Partner
Favorite Restaurant:
The Green Room Cafe for a fresh & healthy meal
Favorite Hidden Gem:
Wicked Pineapple for their acai bowls.
What would people be surprised to hear about the Space Coast:
Last year NASA's Kennedy Space Center supported a record number of launches from the Space Coast. We are excited to see if they can make history and do it again this year with a record number of launches! The launches can be viewed from the comfort of many of our oceanfront patios, or from the Chateau by the Sea rooftop deck. It's one of the largest in the area and is exclusive to guests staying there!
What do you love most about working at SICB?:
I love hearing about our guests' stay with us! It's very rewarding getting a 5 star review from a happy guest that had an amazing experience, and wants to come back to stay with us again!
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
I love starting the day with a coffee at Juice & Java, then enjoy hanging by the pool with my family. In the afternoon we love to find a local patio to eat outdoors, like 4th Street Fillin Station, where I can try an awesome local beer. We love ending the day with a walk on the beach to catch the beautiful sunset!
Dean
Partner
Favorite Restaurant:
There are so many great ones in the area! For a special date night, I would recommend the Fat Snook.
Favorite Hidden Gem:
Cafe Surfinista for their great local surf vibe, coffee and acai bowls.
What people would be surprised to hear about the Space Coast:
I'd say the most common surprises I hear from our guests is how relaxed and charming Cocoa Beach is, and how many things there are for families to do beyond enjoying the beach (things like bioluminescence tours, fishing, space camp, aerial adventure, go karting, etc.)
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
It's the fun, energetic, family atmosphere we all bring working with each other, helping our guests, or enjoying our get-togethers outside of work! It's very difficult to describe but for those who've become part of a small family company, passionate about the mission, it'll be easy to relate!
Jaclyn
Partner
Favorite Restaurant:
Simply Delicious Cafe: A great local spot for breakfast/brunch. I recommend the Eggs Benny or stuffed French Toast!
Favorite Hidden Gem:
The river side of Cocoa Beach - the Banana River has so many interesting isles, nooks and crannies to explore by kayak, boat or stand up paddleboard that is very close to many of our buildings. I love seeing all the manatees and other wildlife!
What would you be surprised to hear about the Space Coast:
That "I Dream of Jeannie" was set in Cocoa Beach & Cape Canaveral. There is a street near Lori Wilson Park named after it.
Perfect Day in Cocoa Beach :
Start by watching the sunrise (they are so spectacular on the beach!), then building sandcastles with my daughters on the beach followed by an ice cream cone at the Fat Donkey in downtown Cocoa Beach and a seafood dinner on a patio enjoying the warm air.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
The energy of the people and constantly finding ways for guests to enjoy their stay. Nothing makes me happier than having people discover our cozy beach town and planning their next stay.
Kathleen
Partner
Favorite Restaurant:
Florida Fresh Grill or Fat Snook for a really special occasion.
Favorite Hidden Gem:
The Brevard Zoo – it’s such a great spot with so many interesting animals to see and things to do. There’s a Treetop Trek course for all levels and even kayak tours available.
What would you be surprised to hear about the Space Coast:
Cocoa Beach is home to the largest Surfing Santas event on Christmas Eve each year. It’s a fun and festive event for the whole family!
What do you love most about working at SICB?:
[Insert answer here]
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Start off the day with an acai bowl from Wicked Pineapples, then spend the morning relaxing on the beach. Grab lunch from Green Turtle Market and finish the day unwinding by the pool.
Steve
Partner
Favorite Restaurant:
Florida Fresh Grill is a great spot for a special night out.
Favorite Hidden Gem:
For the relaxing beach bar, Sandbar never disappoints.
What people would be surprised to hear about the Space Coast:
While not a surprise to those who have been here, it's rare to find such nice white sand beaches without the crowds you might expect. While the area has many attractions, it still has the laid back vibe that makes it so special.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
It has the culture of a small family run company, while still being focused on providing a first rate experience for both our guests and property owners. It is great to see a team filled with people who really care and want to be the best at what they do.
Jason
Accounting
Favorite Restaurant:
Grills Riverside Melbourne: Great food with a great atmosphere. It's located along the Indian River and you often get the chance to see dolphins swimming by.
Favorite Hidden Gem:
Manatee Cove Park in Merritt Island: Secluded park with easy kayaking access to a cove that many manatees call home. Manatees swim right next to the kayak and the cove has access to the Indian River for even more wildlife to be enjoyed.
What people would be surprised to hear about the Space Coast:
It is home to one of the largest charity events in central Florida, Surfing Santas. This event hosts thousands of spectators and hundreds of Surfing Santas each December around Christmas Day. It raises tens of thousands of dollars for local charities and brings attention to the rich surfing culture of Cocoa Beach, all while celebrating the spirit of Christmas in the sunny Space Coast.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
The overall energy and enthusiasm for what SICB provides. The entire staff works together to provide our guests with great experiences when staying with us, while also taking pride in managing our properties to keep them at our high standard. It's exciting to be part of such a positive staff within a quickly growing company.
Jenn
Accounting
Favorite Restaurant:
The Lazy Turtle for the food and the atmosphere & Manny's Cucina Napoletana for all the classic Italian favorites that I can easily grab on the go. Both locations have a lot of gluten free options which is especially appealing to me.
Favorite Hidden Gem:
Wickham Park & The King Center. They are always putting on different events and activities to attend.
What people would be surprised to hear about the Space Coast:
There was an episode on Breaking Bad where it showed Kim had retreated to the Space Coast; I remember very clearly her mentioning a restaurant off of Wickham and her work commute looking super familiar!
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
I am surrounded by some really great individuals. The staff really care about their guests and taking care of their staff including  making a point to show appreciation to every employee's part in the company's success.  Everyone is also continually working towards and the aim to make it the best experience possible for everyone involved.
Blayne
Repair & Maintenance
Favorite Restaurant:
Tokyo Japanese Steakhouse in Cocoa Beach. A great teppanyaki experience.
Favorite hidden gem:
Kiwanis Island Park - it is a community river park nearby in Merritt Island for fishing, sports, an exercise trail, paddling and boating.
What would you be surprised to hear about the Space Coast?
It snowed here once a long time ago!
Perfect Day in Cocoa Beach?
Spending all day at the beach!
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
The people.
Dave
Repair & Maintenance
Hometown:
California City, CA
Favorite Restaurant:
That Little Restaurant in Melbourne. Always a hit for a great breakfast!
Favorite hidden gem:
The secluded, public beach access up and down A1A that can only be discovered on a bike or walks.
What would you be surprised to hear about the Space Coast?
The storm severity is less intense in this location for hurricanes. NASA's decision to settle here was largely based on that information.
Perfect Day in Cocoa Beach?
Sunny day, cool breeze and bicycle ride along the beach.
What do you love most about working at SICB?:
All of the staff treat you like family. Everyone is a team player and contributes to the morale of others. I love interacting with our guests as well and hearing their stories.
Edwin
Repair & Maintenance
Hometown:
I’m originally from Huntington Station, New York
Favorite Restaurant:
Oh Biscuit in Melbourne is my go-to for a quick, satisfying breakfast. Their biscuits never miss!
Favorite Hidden Gem:
The lush trails at Turkey Creek Sanctuary — peaceful, scenic, and perfect for a nature walk.
What would you be surprised to hear about the Space Coast?
I had no idea the Space Coast hosted such thrilling air shows! Seeing jets roar overhead while standing on the beach? It’s unforgettable.
Perfect Day in Cocoa Beach?
Spending quality time with family and being involved in church.
What do you love most about working at SICB?:
The people here truly show up for one another. Anytime I’ve needed help, someone’s been there to lend a hand.
Gage
Repair & Maintenance
Favorite Restaurant:
Salsas Cocina in Cocoa Beach for great Mexican food.
Favorite hidden gem:
The Cocoa Beach Surf Company - it is a great alternative to Ron Jons Surf Shop.
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Enjoying the sunshine with no rain!
Ian
Repair & Maintenance
Favorite Restaurant:
Crydermans Barbecue in Cocoa Village and Edelweiss for their German food.
Favorite hidden gem:
In Viera there is a great biking nature preserve area in the marshland.
Perfect Day in Cocoa Beach?
Definitely spending it at the beach with good food and music and friends.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
The teamwork and communication.
James
Repair & Maintenance
Hometown:
Cocoa Beach, FL
Favorite Restaurant:
Carabba’s Italian Grill in Merritt Island. Great easy family friendly spot.
Favorite hidden gem:
Preacher Bar & Grill – a really neat low lit tavern, with an eclectic menu and over 50 craft beers to choose from!
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
We have had snow here! Don’t worry, it only happens once every couple of decades.
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Watch the sunrise (we get spectacular sunrises over the beach), spend the morning by the water, have lunch outside at Sandbar, relax on the beach and end with dinner at SquidLips watching the sunset.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
The ease of getting things accomplished with the support of the whole team - and seeing the guests enjoy themselves at our properties.
Josiah
Repair & Maintenance
Hometown:
Boise, Idaho
Favorite Restaurant:
Mexico’s Grill – Great atmosphere to relax and settle into the coast! Incredible choice of food and drinks to start or end the weekend!
Favorite Hidden Gem:
There’s plenty of fun activities around! Cocoa Beach sunset tours, airshows, and rocket launches. My personal favorite is the Comb Jelly Bioluminescence Clear Kayak Glow Tour or Florida Bioluminescence Kayaking Tour.
What would people be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
The Space Coast has the largest nesting grounds for loggerhead sea turtles, so keep your eyes out for their tracks in the sand!
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
My perfect day would conclude a fresh seafood lunch and drinks with friends, swimming and a relaxing nap at Cocoa Beach, and finally a large dish of ice cream to top it off!
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
The best part of this job is the people. Their willingness to help one another and serve one another is what stands out from other companies. This company provides a friendly family environment.
Justin
Repair & Maintenance
Hometown:
Acadia, FL
Favorite Restaurant:
Rusty's by Port Canaveral.
Favorite hidden gem:
Kennedy Space Center being able to head over there for the day to learn about its history.
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
It’s home to one of the largest nesting sites of loggerhead sea turtles.
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Having lunch in the port and heading to the beach to enjoy the rest of your day.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
Being able to have a view of the beach all day!
Chloe
Staging
Hometown:
Hastings, England
Favorite Restaurant:
Crackers Island Grille - get the alligator bites!
Favorite hidden gem:
The springs throughout Central Florida. Beautiful, hidden old Florida natural wonders.
What people would be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
Certain times of the year you can see the bioluminescence in the river, I highly recommend this experience!
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Visit the dog friendly beaches, and lounge at the pool relaxing in the sun all day.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
I love getting the chance to beautify our owners' places and make our properties feel like home away from home.
Dayana
Cleaning Inspector
Favorite Restaurant:
Coconuts on the Beach.
Favorite hidden gem:
The Cloud Parlow Speakeasy Cafe in Cocoa Beach. A really cool spot!
What would you be surprised to hear about the Space Coast?
That Kelly Slater the professional surfer is from Cocoa Beach.
Perfect Day in Cocoa Beach?
Head out on the boat with family and friends all day long.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
It is truly a family-friendly workplace!
Vanessa
Cleaning Inspector
Favorite Restaurant:
Taverna Opa
Hidden Gem:
Romelia Farms is a 36-acre petting zoo & Wildlife preserve located in Merritt island. Interact with 160+ farm & exotic animals including camels, horses, donkeys, goats, pigs, cows, lemurs & more!
What would you be surprised to hear about the Space Coast:
People are surprised to learn that the 60's sitcom " I dream of jeannie" helped put cocoa beach on the map. People love taking pictures under the road sign "I dream of Jeannie Lane " near Lori Wilson park where you can also see how they honored their legacy with a roadside plaque outside the park.
Perfect Day in Cocoa Beach?
The perfect way to start my day would be watching the sunrise and having breakfast at the pier. Then head to the banana river to kayak around the mangrove islands where you will have a chance to see dolphins,Manatees, Pelicans, Osprey, Bald Eagles and many more wildlife. I would end my day at "Coconuts" , a restaurant right on the beach with great food and drinks.
Lina
Cleaning Inspector
Favorite Restaurant:
Flavors of India
Hidden Gem:
White Sands Buddhist Temple (Mims, FL)
What would you be surprised to hear about the Space Coast:
That people from all over the world visit here daily.
Perfect Day in Cocoa Beach?
A chill, relaxing afternoon at the beach with family—after 3 PM when the heat starts to ease.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
The excellent customer service delivered by our efficient and effective team.
Shannon
Hometown:
West Palm Beach, FL
Favorite Restaurant:
Grills
Hidden Gem:
Peacock Beach
What would people be surprised to learn about the Space Coast?
The area code for the Space Coast is "3-2-1" in honor of rocket launches.
Describe your perfect day in Cocoa Beach:
Spend the afternoon exploring the unique shops in Historic Cocoa Village or enjoying the beach.
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?
The positive and collaborative team environment, where everyone works together to provide exceptional guest experiences and support each other.
Sue
Laundry
Favorite Restaurant:
Gators Dockside Restaurant - great fresh seafood and view of the cruise ships and an occasional view of dolphins swimming through the port.
Hidden Gem:
Lone Cabbage fish camp! Enjoy a great fried seafood basket like gator tail and take a fun airboat ride and view our local wildlife.
What would you be surprised to hear about the Space Coast:
Taking a riverboat ride  around our local rivers and learning about our wildlife like manatees and help preserve and keeps our rivers clean.
Perfect Day in Cocoa Beach?
Sitting on the beach with my husband  Ray watching the rockets taking off!
What do you love most about working at Happy Palm Stays?:
Enjoying the people I work with and how helpful and friendly everyone is.
Modal
×

Boardwalk Cocoa Beach, FL Highlighted Amenities & Features Pool Elevator Free Parking Welcome to Boardwalk! Welcome to Boardwork, a charming building located on the beach and steps to the heart of downtown Cocoa Beach's quaint shops and restaurants. Our inviting beachfront property offers the perfect blend of comfort, convenience, and coastal charm for your Florida getaway. Step into our bright, airy accommodations designed to capture the relaxed spirit of beach living. Each unit features modern amenities while maintaining the warm, welcoming atmosphere that makes Boardwork special. Wake up to breathtaking ocean views, relax by the pool, fall asleep to gentle wave sounds, and make yourself completely at home in between. Our prime location puts you steps from the sand and minutes from Cocoa Beach's vibrant attractions. Surf the legendary waves that have made this area famous, stroll along the historic pier, or simply unwind on your private balcony with the Atlantic stretching before you. Welcome to Boardwalk! Welcome to Boardwork, a charming building located on the beach and steps to the heart of downtown Cocoa Beach's quaint shops and restaurants. Our inviting beachfront property offers the perfect blend of comfort, convenience, and coastal charm for your Florida getaway. Step into our bright, airy accommodations designed to capture the relaxed spirit of beach living. Each unit features modern amenities while maintaining the warm, welcoming atmosphere that makes Boardwork special. Wake up to breathtaking ocean views, relax by the pool, fall asleep to gentle wave sounds, and make yourself completely at home in between. Our prime location puts you steps from the sand and minutes from Cocoa Beach's vibrant attractions. Surf the legendary waves that have made this area famous, stroll along the historic pier, or simply unwind on your private balcony with the Atlantic stretching before you. If you’re the type of traveler that can’t get enough of destinations that are brimming over with sun, sand, and surf to enjoy, you’re definitely going to want to add Cocoa Beach, Florida to your list of must-visit locales this year! At Happy Palm Stays, we specialize in helping guests make even more of their Cocoa Beach stay with every booking. We’re proud to provide our guests with access to a collection of amazing vacation rentals that not only meet their travel needs but exceed their expectations too. Visitors who find the idea of a downtown Cocoa Beach stay endlessly exciting will love every minute spent in our property options within Boardwalk Condominiums while they’re in town. Travelers who choose to book a stay at Boardwalk will find themselves calling a prime area location their home away from home while they’re here. Located at 15 N. Atlantic Avenue, Boardwalk is a multi-level community right on the beach that offers guests stunning waterfront views to enjoy every day of their stay. Condo options within the complex are vast and varied, making it simple for visitors to fit a luxury rental that can accommodate their crew with ease. No matter what property option guests select within Boardwalk, they’ll find they have the privacy and comfort they need alongside easy access to downtown area fun as well. Downtown Cocoa Beach is home stores, restaurants, bars, and of course amazing shoreline—all of which are within walking distance of the Boardwalk condos. Condo options in Boardwalk often offer guests a spacious floor plan to enjoy during their stay that makes it even easier to settle into luxury and style. These spacious layouts enhance the square footage across the entire space and make it simple for guests to move easily between living, dining, entertainment, sleep, and lounge areas during their Florida getaway. Typically, guests who book a Boardwalk condo while visiting Cocoa Beach will find that their property is also equipped with features like large windows and tall ceilings throughout. This combination works to frame a breathtaking view, enhance the overall sense of space further, and promote the best of natural light flow throughout the condo too. It also works to bring the coastal beauty of the outdoors right inside! Furnishings found in all of our Boardwalk beach resort condos for rent are not only comfortable but tastefully integrated into a coastal-inspired aesthetic. Guests will love the refreshing balance between luxury and home comforts that makes it endlessly appealing to cozy up and enjoy time at your very own pace while you’re here. Furnishing collections typically include plush sofas and comfortable loveseats as well as modern coffee tables, colorful area rugs, decorative wall art, innovative lighting, and more. For those times when guests aren’t out exploring Cocoa Beach or downtown and they’re looking forward to time inside, condos at Boardwalk are set up to make customized entertainment a breeze. Many Boardwalk beach rentals here come with Wi-Fi internet connections as well. This means that our guests can always kick back, relax, and spend an evening in streaming movies and shows on large flat-screen televisions at just the touch of a button. Similarly, guests have options to check in on the headlines, share photos with family back home, or update social media to reflect all their latest Cocoa Beach adventures. After a day of Cocoa Beach discoveries, guests will find a good night’s rest waiting for them as well when they book a condo at Boardwalk. Bedrooms in our property options of this type are often spacious and enjoy large bedroom sets topped off with high-quality linens, plush mattresses, and eye-catching comforters too. If you are the type that needs to take time to wind down before heading to bed, consider booking a condo with a full balcony or patio so you can enjoy settling in under the stars and finding your Zen before getting a good night’s rest. There’s Always More to Enjoy in Cocoa Beach Travelers who are heading to Cocoa Beach in the name of a well-deserved vacation often have their sights set on time out enjoying the mouthwatering moments waiting at local restaurants. Whether you’re one for fresh-caught fare or you have a hankering for global-inspired cuisine, it’s all available to be enjoyed here. That said, those who choose to book a condo at Boardwalk can also savor home-style meals when that’s what would hit the spot during their stay. Many Boardwalk units host full kitchens for guests to use that come with everything needed to serve up a savory breakfast, lunch, or dinner option. These culinary spaces often showcase spacious counters, plenty of cabinetry, cooking and baking essentials as well as a collection of modern appliances. When kitchens have dishes and utensils in place too, guests are free to put their creativity in the kitchen to work! When it’s time to dine, visitors will find that many condos have large dining room tables to gather around and enjoy a good meal in great company. Similarly, those furnished balconies and decks make for great places for Boardwalk guests to savor an al fresco meal too. When a little added luxury would do wonders for enhancing the getaway experience in Cocoa Beach, those who have booked a stay in Boardwalk are in luck. A reservation here means easy access to the many community amenities as well. When temperatures rise, guests are free to take a dip in the large on-site pool. The pool is even heated when temperatures fall at other times of the year, making swimming an option for guests year-round. Boardwalk also has direct beach access points to make time on the sand even more convenient for visitors. Additionally, booking a stay here comes with convenient free parking options and elevator service for condos located on upper levels. Book Your Getaway to Cocoa Beach Today There’s no reason to wait when a sensational getaway to Cocoa Beach, Florida is calling your name. At Happy Palm Stays, we’re ready and waiting to handle your accommodation details the next time travel plans bring you this way so that you can focus exclusively on the fun and adventure ahead! Reach out today to learn more about booking a stay in Boardwalk, or to inquire about one of our other many exciting property options including short-term rentals and weekly rentals available in and around Cocoa Beach. Our team can’t wait to see you in sunny Florida soon. FAQs About Our Boardwalk Condos Are your Boardwalk condos near the beach? A beach vacation should be spent as close to the beach as possible, and our Happy Palm Stays Boardwalk properties lie on the white sand beaches for which we are famous. Offering stunning views of turquoise waters and a quick commute to your toes in the sand sessions, our Boardwalk escapes are also located near the downtown area of Cocoa Beach. Our children are obsessed with dinosaurs. We know it isn’t a typical beach vacation activity, but are there any dinosaur museums in the area? ocoa Beach offers something for everyone, and yes, that includes dino lovers! The Dinosaur Store is the home of the Museum of Dinosaurs & Ancient Cultures and dives deep into the existence of dinosaurs and provides three different experiences in one. An Adventure Zone, museum, and exciting gift shop that we are sorry to say you probably won’t be able to escape without making your budget cringe just a little, will be the one activity your dino-obsessed littles will never be bored with. Tell us something we don’t know about Cocoa Beach. Everyone knows that Cocoa Beach lies on the Space Coast and that its beaches draw visitors from all over the world, but did you know that it was also an important part of the World Wars? This tranquil area was expected to be where German U-boats would crash, and residents were expected to black out their east facing windows and their car headlights using black tape to make it easier for the U-boats to lose their way and crash in the total darkness. Everything looks so new in Cocoa Beach. Is there any historical significance to the area? The Ais Village Trail is a historical preservation group that is actively involved in some exciting excavations right now in Cocoa Beach, with one site dating between 800 and 1500 AD. From that site they have uncovered trade beads from Spain, bone pins, and ship spikes that tell the story of life in those long ago times.
